DOC.brief_summary: The routine use of a styletted endotracheal tube during videolaryngoscopy is advocated by some manufacturers, but styletted endotracheal tube can elicit rare but potentially serious complications. We compared the intubation time and success rate whether or not use of stylet for endotracheal intubation with McGrath videolaryngoscope.
DOC.criteria: American Society of Anesthesiologists physical status I or II undergoing orotracheal intubation for elective surgery cervical spine injury rapid sequence induction body mass index> 35 kg/m2 airway pathology
